channel.title: CyberNetSec - Mobile Security
channel.description: Latest mobile security threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: SmartTube App Compromised: Malicious Update Pushed via Stolen Keys
item.description:
A significant supply chain attack has compromised the popular ad-free YouTube client for Android TV, SmartTube. An attacker stole the developer's signing keys and distributed a malicious update containing surveillance-style malware through official channels. The malware, hidden in versions 30.43 thr...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Backs Down on Mandatory Pre-Installed Government "Snooping App"
item.description:
Following widespread criticism from privacy advocates and significant resistance from major tech companies, the Indian government has withdrawn a controversial directive that would have required smartphone makers like Apple and Samsung to pre-install a non-deletable, state-owned security app. The ap...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Urgent Android Update: Google Patches 107 Flaws, Two Zero-Days Under Active Attack
item.description:
Google has issued its December 2025 Android security bulletin, patching a total of 107 vulnerabilities. The update is critical, as it addresses two high-severity zero-days, CVE-2025-48633 (Information Disclosure) and CVE-2025-48572 (Elevation of Privilege), which are under limited, targeted exploita...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Nova Stealer' Malware Targets macOS Crypto Wallets
item.description:
A new information-stealing malware, dubbed 'Nova Stealer,' has been discovered actively targeting Apple macOS users. The malware's primary goal is the exfiltration of sensitive data, with a specific focus on cryptocurrency wallets. Nova Stealer operates as a trojan, infecting systems by replacing le...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Samsung Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild to Install 'LANDFALL' Android Spyware
item.description:
A now-patched zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-21042, in Samsung Galaxy devices was actively exploited to install a commercial-grade Android spyware known as LANDFALL. Researchers from Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 discovered that attackers sent malicious DNG image files via WhatsApp to targets in the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Zscaler: 239 Malicious Apps on Google Play Downloaded 42 Million Times
item.description:
A new report from Zscaler's ThreatLabz, published November 5, 2025, reveals a dramatic 67% year-over-year increase in Android malware. Researchers identified 239 malicious applications that successfully bypassed Google Play Store security, amassing a collective 42 million downloads before being remo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Patches Critical Zero-Click RCE Flaw in Android; Millions of Devices at Risk
item.description:
Google's November 2025 Android Security Bulletin includes a patch for a critical zero-click remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-48593. The flaw, residing in the Android System component, affects Android versions 13, 14, 15, and 16, and allows remote attackers to compromise...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Samsung's November Security Update Patches 45 Vulnerabilities, Including Critical Android Flaws
item.description:
Samsung has released its November 2025 security maintenance release, delivering patches for 45 vulnerabilities affecting its Galaxy smartphones and tablets. The update incorporates Google's latest Android patches, including a fix for the critical zero-click RCE vulnerability CVE-2025-48593. Addition...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Herodotus Android Malware Mimics Human Typing to Bypass Biometric Security
item.description:
A new Android banking trojan named Herodotus has emerged, offered as a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) by a threat actor known as 'K1R0'. The malware is notable for its novel evasion technique: it mimics human typing behavior by introducing random delays during remote control sessions. This method is sp...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Enacts New Telecom Cybersecurity Rules for IMEI and Mobile Number Validation
item.description:
India's Ministry of Communications has enacted new cybersecurity regulations for its telecommunications sector, effective October 22, 2025. The 'Telecommunications (Telecom Cyber Security) Amendment Rules, 2025' introduce two key measures: the establishment of a centralized Mobile Number Validation ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Mobile Security
